doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 44 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 10/28/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 44 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 10/28/1987]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Marie Manion, Arthur W. Strickler, and Jeffrey Golding, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund2.Discussion about the Gay and Lesbian March on WashingtonCOMMERCIAL:Human Rights Campaign3.Discussion about how the press represented the Gay and Lesbian March on WashingtonCOMMERCIAL:Village Pointe Condos4.Andy Humm reflects upon his experience at The Names Project5.News Watch, Philadelphia organization, [Les Femmes] falsly advertised a all lesbian cruise to Bermuda6.Discussion about Shere Hite's book, "Woman and Love: A Cultural Revolution in Progress"7.Announcement about Lesbian nightclub events and New York City Gay Men's Chorus Halloween Party8.Footage from the Human Rights Campaign Dinner where Nathan Kolodor, President of Board, GMHC awarded Larry Kramer the arts award9.Lavender Health, Footage from the film, "AIDS Changing the Rules"10.Closing Credits
The Right Stuff:1.Show Bitz, discussion about the gay play, "Farm Boys"COMMERCIAL:Gay Treasures2.Naming Names, criticism regarding the AIDS misinformation in William F. Buckley Jr. article in The Daily News3.Razor Sharp talks about the film "Too Outrageous," The Pyramid Club, and Halloween4."Short Bits of Wisdom From Daddy" by Perry BrassCOMMERCIAL:Village Pointe Condos5.Rosa von Praunheim interviews Craig Russell from the film, "Too Outrageous"6.Inside Out, Episode, "Bruce's Dungeon on the Lake." 6.Closing Credits
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 44 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 10/28/1987]: October 1987
